title: frames drop
body: So my game starts out at 50 -40 FPS and thats where i usually run at sometimes 30 FPS then now after a couple months of not playing I got back on and I started a custom game to make sure everything runs fine and it started at 40 FPS then ran fine until about 2 minutes into the game it started to drop to about 20 then to 6 FPS and it won't go back up what do I do? I tried uninstalling and then it started a repair that said error so I'm not sure what to do.

replies.body:
Information helps.

Get hwinfo64 if you do not have it already.

https://www.hwinfo.com/

Run it and post a picture of the hardware specifications for your system.

While running a game, open the sensor window and record your CPU frequencies (speed) per core, temperature (highest, average), GPU speed, usage percent, and temperature, VRAM (video memory) usage, and RAM (system memory) usage.

With a starting fps that bad, chances are your computer is just a piece of shit and is throttling speed due to thermals or experiencing SWAP thrash (a very amusing term for a very annoying behavior) due to lack of memory.
